newsitem.title: USA: Empty sailboat found off Massachusetts coast.
newsitem.headline: Empty sailboat found off Massachusetts coast.

text.p: The U.S. Coast Guard spotted a 26-foot sailboat adrift off the coast of Marblehead, Massachusetts early Monday and later found the boat's skipper floating in the ocean 13 miles away, officials said.
"The unusual condition of the boat alerted the Coast Guard to take a closer look and it was discovered there was no one on board," Coast Guard Senior Chief Petty Officer Glenn Rosenholm said.

The boat's motor was still running and its sail was up when it was found early Monday. Hours later a Coast Guard vessel found the boat's skipper afloat three miles off the coast of Cohasset, Massachusetts, he said.
Angelica Savage, 36, of Wellesley, Massachusetts, was taken to a Coast Guard station in Hull where she was pronounced dead, Rosenholm said.
The skies were clear Sunday night when Savage sailed the sail boat Windsong from Boston Harbour, Coast Guard Petty Officer Jay Lipinski said.
"There was no small craft advisory out or anything like that," he said. "We have no indication of what happened."
